subtitle.Text: Hi, this is Corin Tucker from Heavens to Betsy

and Heavens to Betsy was a band that formed in 1991 actually, and I actually got the idea for joining a band when I moved to Olympia, Washington and became a fan of the music scene there and it seemed like everyone was in a band.

So I decided I was going to start a band too, but I didn’t actually start the band until I went home after the first year of college, I went back to Eugene, Oregon and my highschool friend Tracy Sawyer and I started playing music together and that was the beginning of Heavens to Betsy.

So I had told, you know, with my big mouth I had told all my friends that I was going to start a band and the summer of I think it was 1991, my friend Michelle Noel booked the International Pop Underground in Olympia, Washington

and she helped organize a night at the convention called Girl Night, and it was all women musicians. So she called me and said, ‘Hey! Let’s get you on stage! You want to play the show that I’m organizing!’

So, you know, this totally new band that had never performed before, we had never performed ever - any kind of music - got invited to play this big show at the Capitol Theater in Olympia in front of all of our musical heroes,
everyone from K Records, all of Fugazi was there, all of Bikini Kill was there, you know, this music that I was a huge fan of suddenly - that was our very first show,
the very first Heavens to Betsy show and we were terrified. But we did it, and people loved it and it was, you know, it changed my life forever, that night.
